source.name: CANADA - SPECIAL ECONOMIC MEASURES - RUSSIA - CANSEMRUS

category.description: This gives details of individuals, companies and vessels with whom national or supranational bodies have decreed firms should not have financial dealings. Dealings with these designated persons or entities can lead to large fines, jail sentences and increased regulatory oversight owing to perceived failures in systems of internal control.
category.name: Sanctions

actions.text: Dec 2014 - addition. Feb 2015 - list officially confirmed. PRIMARY NAME: Yuri Leonidovich VOROBYOV.

actions.text: EU 269/2014. 2014/145/CFSP (Sep 2014 - addition. Sep 2015 - amended). PRIMARY NAME: Yuri Leonidovich VOROBIOV. Identifying information: DOB 2.2.1948 POB: Krasnoyarsk. Reasons: Deputy Speaker of the Federation Council of the Russian Federation. On 1 March 2014 Vorobiov publicly supported in the Federation Council the deployment of Russian forces in Ukraine. He subsequently voted in favour of the related decree.

details.title: CANADA SANCTIONS - CANSEMRUS

details.text: Member of the Federation Council representing Vologda Region (May 2007 - 2016) (Sep 2016 - ). Deputy Chairman of the Federation Council of the Federal Assembly (Sep 2008 - Mar 2011). First Deputy Minister of the Russian Federation for Civil Defence, Extraordinary Situations and Disaster Relief (Jan 1994 - May 2007). Member of Edinaya Rossiya.
details.title: BIOGRAPHY

details.text: EU 269/2014. 2014/145/CFSP (Sep 2014 - addition. Sep 2015 - amended). PRIMARY NAME: Yuri Leonidovich VOROBIOV. Identifying information: DOB 2.2.1948 POB: Krasnoyarsk. Reasons: Deputy Speaker of the Federation Council of the Russian Federation. On 1 March 2014 Vorobiov publicly supported in the Federation Council the deployment of Russian forces in Ukraine. He subsequently voted in favour of the related decree.

category.description: This gives details of high-ranking government officials in over 200 countries. Although there may be no reason why you should not do business with these individuals, the Basle Committee on Banking supervision has stated that one should check these customers because without this due diligence, banks can become subject to reputational, operational, legal and concentration risks, which can result in significant financial cost.
